title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Internet and Software Customer Success Managers

content.rendered:
What is an Internet and Software Customer Success Manager?

Internet and Software Customer Success and Account Managers specialize in working with internet and software customers to ensure that they are getting the best support and tools.

Where does an Internet and Software Customer Success Manager work?

  • Large or small companies

How much does an Internet and Software Customer Success Manager make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an internet and software customer service success manager is $56,647.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Internet and Software Customer Success Managers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing Internet and software Success manager jobs.

  • Business majors
  • Advertising majors
  • Public relation majors
Explore Internet and Software Customer Service Manager job opportunities on Handshake.

Internet and Software Customer Service Managers skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Internet and Software Customer Service Managers succeed in their work:

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Great customer service
  • Programming knowledge

What are some common questions about Internet and Software Customer Success Managers?

Q: How will my role as a customer success manager help my professional growth?

A: You’ll learn how to manage clients, communicate with many people effectively, and start your growth into project management.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming an Internet Success Manager.
